chunks.title: Regulation 1 - Short title
chunks.main_structural_heading: Short title
chunks.structure_path: Part 1 - PRELIMINARY > Regulation 1
chunks.text:
This regulation may be cited as the Payroll Tax Regulation 2019.
Commencement

chunks.title: Regulation 2 - Commencement
chunks.main_structural_heading: Commencement
chunks.structure_path: Part 1 - PRELIMINARY > Regulation 2
chunks.text:
This regulation commences on 2 September 2019.
Definitions

chunks.title: Regulation 3 - Definitions
chunks.main_structural_heading: Definitions
chunks.structure_path: Part 1 - PRELIMINARY > Regulation 3
chunks.text:
The dictionary in schedule 1 defines particular words used in this regulation.
Value of taxable wagesâAct, s 13

chunks.title: Regulation 4 - Value of taxable wagesâAct, s 13
chunks.main_structural_heading: Value of taxable wagesâAct, s 13
chunks.structure_path: Part 2 - LIABILITY TO TAXATION > Regulation 4
chunks.text:
For section 13 (1) of the Act, the value of taxable wages paid or payable in
kind by an employer (other than fringe benefits under the Fringe Benefits
Assessment Act) is the highest of the following amountsâ
     (a) the amount agreed under arrangements between the employer and
     employee as the value of the taxable wages;
     (b) the amount attributed by the employer as the value of the taxable
     wages having regard to arrangements between the employer and
     employee;
     (c) the amount worked out by a person appointed by the commissioner
     under section 13 (3) of the Act as the value of the taxable wages
     having regard to arrangements between the employer and employee.
Things that are not fringe benefitsâAct, sch, definition fringe benefit

chunks.title: Regulation 5 - Things that are not fringe benefitsâAct, sch, definition fringe benefit
chunks.main_structural_heading: Things that are not fringe benefitsâAct, sch, definition fringe benefit
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 1 - Preliminary > Regulation 5
chunks.text:
(1) For the schedule of the Act, definition
     "fringe benefit", paragraph (d), a tax-exempt body entertainment
     fringe benefit is prescribed not to be a fringe benefit.
     (2) In this sectionâ
     "tax-exempt body entertainment fringe benefit" see the Fringe
     Benefits Assessment Act, section 136 (1).
Notice of amended assessments under the Fringe Benefits Assessment Act

chunks.title: Regulation 6 - Notice of amended assessments under the Fringe Benefits Assessment Act
chunks.main_structural_heading: Notice of amended assessments under the Fringe Benefits Assessment Act
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 1 - Preliminary > Regulation 6
chunks.text:
An employer must, within 30 days of receiving a notice of an amended assessment
under the Fringe Benefits Assessment Act, give the commissioner a copy of the
notice.
     Penalty--
          Maximum penaltyâ20 penalty units.
Calculation of fringe benefits on same basis

chunks.title: Regulation 7 - Calculation of fringe benefits on same basis
chunks.main_structural_heading: Calculation of fringe benefits on same basis
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 1 - Preliminary > Regulation 7
chunks.text:
(1) An employer must calculate fringe benefits on the same basis for
     a financial yearâ
          (a) for each periodic, annual or final return lodged by the
          employer for the financial year; and
          (b) for working out the employerâs relevant payroll tax
          and levy liabilities for the financial year; and
          (c) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâfor giving
          information to the DGE for the group under sections 88A,
          88B, 88C or 88D of the Act in relation to the financial
          year; and
          (d) if the employer is the DGE for a groupâfor giving
          information to non-DGE group members under section 88A or
          88E of the Act in relation to the financial year, to the
          extent the information relates to the DGE.
          Noteâ
               Non-compliance with subsection (1) may affectâ
                    (a) if the employer is not a group
                    member or is the DGE for a groupâthe
                    employerâs liability for payroll tax
                    and the mental health levy; or
                    (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group
                    memberâ
                         (i) the employerâs
                         liability for payroll tax;
                         and
                         (ii) the liability of the
                         employer and the DGE for the
                         group for the mental health
                         levy.
     (2) This section is subject to sections 11 to 13.
Purpose of division

chunks.title: Regulation 8 - Purpose of division
chunks.main_structural_heading: Purpose of division
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 2 - Basis for calculating fringe benefitsâAct, s 91 > Subdivision 1 - Preliminary > Regulation 8
chunks.text:
This division provides, for section 91 (1) and (3) (b) of the Act, for the
election by an employer to include in returns an estimated value amount, or an
actual value amount, for fringe benefits.
Application of subdivision

chunks.title: Regulation 9 - Application of subdivision
chunks.main_structural_heading: Application of subdivision
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 2 - Basis for calculating fringe benefitsâAct, s 91 > Subdivision 2 - Electing to calculate fringe benefits on estimated value basis > Regulation 9
chunks.text:
This subdivision applies to an employer who has paid, or is liable to pay,
fringe benefits tax for at least 15 consecutive months immediately before the
start of a financial year (a
"relevant financial year").
Election in first periodic return period for relevant financial year

chunks.title: Regulation 10 - Election in first periodic return period for relevant financial year
chunks.main_structural_heading: Election in first periodic return period for relevant financial year
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 2 - Basis for calculating fringe benefitsâAct, s 91 > Subdivision 2 - Electing to calculate fringe benefits on estimated value basis > Regulation 10
chunks.text:
(1) The employer may elect to include in returns estimated value
     amounts and use those amounts to work out the employerâs prelevant
     payroll tax and levy liabilities.
     (2) The employer makes an election under subsection (1) by using an
     estimated value amount to work out the employerâs periodic
     liability and periodic levy liability for the first periodic return
     period for the relevant financial year.
     (3) An election under subsection (1) continues to apply until the
     employer elects, under subdivision 3, to use actual value amounts to
     work out the employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy liabilities.
     (4) If an election under subsection (1) applies to the employer on 30
     June in the relevant financial year or a later financial year, the
     employer must include an estimated value amount as part of the wages
     paid or payable during that year by the employerâ
          (a) in the employerâs annual return for the financial
          year; and
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâin the
          information given to the DGE under section 88A (5) of the
          Act in relation to the financial year.
     (5) An election under subsection (1) applies for working outâ
          (a) periodic liability and periodic levy liability for the
          periodic return period mentioned in subsection (2); and
          (b) all subsequent relevant payroll tax and levy
          liabilities for the employer while the election continues
          to apply.
Election during relevant financial year

chunks.title: Regulation 11 - Election during relevant financial year
chunks.main_structural_heading: Election during relevant financial year
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 2 - Basis for calculating fringe benefitsâAct, s 91 > Subdivision 2 - Electing to calculate fringe benefits on estimated value basis > Regulation 11
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies ifâ
          (a) the employer wants to elect to include in returns
          estimated value amounts and use those amounts to work out
          the employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy liabilities
          for the relevant financial year; and
          (b) the employer has not made an election under section 10
          (1) for the relevant financial year.
     (2) The employer must apply to the commissioner for consent to make
     the election.
     (3) An application under subsection (2) must be in writing.
     (4) The commissioner must consider the application and decide whether
     or not to give the consent.
     (5) The commissioner may give the consent only if reasonably
     satisfiedâ
          (a) the main purpose for the employerâs election is not
          to avoid or reduce the amount of payroll tax or mental
          health levy that would otherwise be payable for the
          relevant financial year if the payroll tax or mental health
          levy were calculated on an actual value basis; and
          (b) the employer, because of the employerâs
          circumstances, has compelling reasons for making the
          election.
     (6) The commissioner must give the employer written notice of the
     commissionerâs decision.
     (7) If the commissioner consents to the election, the employer must
     elect to include in returns estimated value amounts and use those
     amounts to work out the employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy
     liabilities.
     (8) An election under subsection (7) â
          (a) is made by the employer using an estimated value amount
          to work out the employerâs periodic liability and
          periodic levy liability for the first periodic return
          period after receiving the consent; and
          (b) continues to apply until the employer elects, under
          subdivision 3, to use actual value amounts to work out the
          employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy liabilities; and
          (c) applies for working outâ
               (i) periodic liability and periodic levy
               liability for the periodic return period
               mentioned in paragraph (a); and
               (ii) all subsequent relevant payroll tax and levy
               liabilities for the employer while the election
               continues to apply.
     (9) If the employer makes an election under subsection (7), the
     employer mustâ
          (a) use the value of the employerâs Queensland fringe
          benefits for the last year of tax to work outâ
               (i) the employerâs annual liability for the
               relevant financial year; and
               (ii) if the employer is not a group member or is
               the DGE for a groupâthe employerâs annual
               levy liability for the relevant financial year;
               and
          (b) include the value of the employerâs Queensland fringe
          benefits for the last year of tax as part of the wages paid
          or payable during the relevant financial year by the
          employerâ
               (i) in the employerâs annual return for the
               financial year; and
               (ii) if the employer is a non-DGE group
               memberâin the information given to the DGE
               under section 88A (5) of the Act for the
               financial year.
     (10) If the election applies to the employer on 30 June in a
     financial year after the relevant financial year (a
     "subsequent financial year"), the employer must include an estimated
     value amount as part of the wages paid or payable during the
     subsequent financial yearâ
          (a) in the employerâs annual return for that financial
          year; and
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâin the
          information given to the DGE under section 88A (5) of the
          Act for that financial year.
     (11) The employer must not purport to make an election under
     subsection (7) unless the employer has received a consent under this
     section.
          Penalty--
               Maximum penalty for subsection (11) â20 penalty
               units.
Election in annual return

chunks.title: Regulation 12 - Election in annual return
chunks.main_structural_heading: Election in annual return
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 2 - Basis for calculating fringe benefitsâAct, s 91 > Subdivision 3 - Electing to calculate fringe benefits on actual value basis > Regulation 12
chunks.text:
(1) An employer, who has made an election under subdivision 2 that
     continues to apply, may elect to include in returns actual value
     amounts and use those amounts to work out the employerâs relevant
     payroll tax and levy liabilities.
     (2) An employer makes an election under subsection (1) by using a
     reconciliation amount to work outâ
          (i) the employerâs annual liability for a financial year;
          and
          (ii) if the employer is not a group member or is the DGE
          for a groupâthe employerâs annual levy liability for
          the financial year.
     (3) If an employer makes an election under subsection (1), the
     employer must include a reconciliation amount as part of the wages
     paid or payable by the employerâ
          (a) in the employerâs returns for the financial year; and
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâin the
          information given to the DGE under section 88A (5) of the
          Act for the financial year.
     (4) An election under subsection (1) continues to apply until the
     employer elects, under subdivision 2, to use estimated value amounts
     to work out the employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy
     liabilities.
     (5) An election under subsection (1) applies for working outâ
          (a) periodic liability for the first periodic return period
          for the financial year immediately after the financial year
          in which the employer uses a reconciliation amount to work
          out the employerâs annual liability and, for an employer
          who is not a group member or is the DGE for a group, the
          employerâs annual levy liability; and
          (b) all subsequent relevant liabilities for the employer
          while the election continues to apply.
     (6) In this sectionâ
     "relevant liability", for an employer, meansâ
          (a) if the employer is not a group member or is the DGE for
          a groupâthe employerâs periodic liability, annual
          liability, final liability, periodic levy liability, annual
          levy liability and final liability; or
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâthe
          employerâs periodic liability, annual liability, final
          liability and periodic levy liability.
Election during financial year

chunks.title: Regulation 13 - Election during financial year
chunks.main_structural_heading: Election during financial year
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 2 - Basis for calculating fringe benefitsâAct, s 91 > Subdivision 3 - Electing to calculate fringe benefits on actual value basis > Regulation 13
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies ifâ
          (a) an employer wants to elect to include in returns actual
          value amounts and use those amounts to work out the
          employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy liabilities; and
          (b) the employer has made an election under subdivision 2
          that continues to apply.
     (2) The employer must apply to the commissioner for consent to make
     the election.
     (3) An application under subsection (2) must be in writing.
     (4) The commissioner must consider the application and decide whether
     or not to give the consent.
     (5) The commissioner may give the consent only if reasonably
     satisfiedâ
          (a) the main purpose for the employerâs election is not
          to avoid or reduce the amount of payroll tax or mental
          health levy that would otherwise be payable for the
          financial year if the payroll tax or mental health levy
          were calculated on an estimated value basis; and
          (b) the employer, because of the employerâs
          circumstances, has compelling reasons for making the
          election.
     (6) The commissioner must give the employer written notice of the
     commissionerâs decision.
     (7) If the commissioner consents to the election, the employer must
     elect to include in returns actual value amounts and use those
     amounts to work out the employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy
     liabilities.
     (8) An election under subsection (7) â
          (a) is made by the employer using an actual value amount to
          work out the employerâs periodic liability and periodic
          levy liability for the first periodic return period after
          receiving the consent; and
          (b) continues to apply until the employer elects, under
          subdivision 2, to use estimated value amounts to work out
          the employerâs relevant payroll tax and levy liabilities;
          and
          (c) applies for working outâ
               (i) periodic liability and periodic levy
               liability for the periodic return period
               mentioned in paragraph (a); and
               (ii) all subsequent relevant liabilities for the
               employer while the election continues to apply.
     (9) If the employer makes an election under subsection (7), the
     employer mustâ
          (a) use a reconciliation amount to work outâ
               (i) the employerâs annual liability for the
               financial year in which the election is made; and
               (ii) if the employer is not a group member or is
               the DGE for a groupâthe employerâs annual
               levy liability for the relevant financial year;
               and
          (b) include the reconciliation amount as part of the wages
          paid or payable during the financial year by the
          employerâ
               (i) in the employerâs annual return for the
               financial year; and
               (ii) if the employer is a non-DGE group
               memberâin the information given to the DGE
               under section 88A (5) of the Act for the
               financial year.
     (10) However, if the employer makes an election under subsection (7)
     and a change of status happens for the employer during the financial
     year in which the election is made, the employer mustâ
          (a) use a reconciliation amount to work out the
          employerâs final liability and, if the employer is not a
          group member or is the DGE for a group, the final levy
          liability for the final period for the change of status;
          and
          (b) include the reconciliation amount as part of the wages
          paid or payable during the final period by the employerâ
               (i) in the employerâs final return for the
               final period; and
               (ii) if the employer is a non-DGE group
               memberâin the information given to the DGE
               under section 88B of the Act.
     (11) The employer must not purport to make an election under
     subsection (7) unless the employer has received a consent under this
     section.
          Penalty--
               Maximum penalty for subsection (11) â20 penalty
               units.
     (12) In this sectionâ
     "relevant liability", for an employer, meansâ
          (a) if the employer is not a group member or is the DGE for
          a groupâthe employerâs periodic liability, annual
          liability, final liability, periodic levy liability, annual
          levy liability and final liability; or
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâthe
          employerâs periodic liability, annual liability, final
          liability and periodic levy liability.
Purpose of division

chunks.title: Regulation 14 - Purpose of division
chunks.main_structural_heading: Purpose of division
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 1 - Preliminary > Regulation 14
chunks.text:
This division prescribes, for section 97 (2) (d) of the Act, what is to be
included in a return as the value of fringe benefits paid or payable by an
employer.
Definition for subdivision

chunks.title: Regulation 15 - Definition for subdivision
chunks.main_structural_heading: Definition for subdivision
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 2 - Value of Queensland fringe benefits > Regulation 15
chunks.text:
In this subdivisionâ
"grossed-up value", of a fringe benefit, means the value of the benefit worked
out using the formula stated in section 13 (5) of the Act.
Value of Queensland fringe benefits for estimated value amount

chunks.title: Regulation 16 - Value of Queensland fringe benefits for estimated value amount
chunks.main_structural_heading: Value of Queensland fringe benefits for estimated value amount
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 2 - Value of Queensland fringe benefits > Regulation 16
chunks.text:
For calculating the estimated value amount for a financial year, the value of
Queensland fringe benefits for the previous year of tax or the last year of tax
is the grossed-up value of the benefits.
Value of Queensland fringe benefits for reconciliation amount, final return and
information given under Act, s 88B

chunks.title: Regulation 17 - Value of Queensland fringe benefits for reconciliation amount, final return and information given under Act, s 88B
chunks.main_structural_heading: Value of Queensland fringe benefits for reconciliation amount, final return and information given under Act, s 88B
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 2 - Value of Queensland fringe benefits > Regulation 17
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies for calculating a reconciliation amount or
     the value of fringe benefits to be included inâ
          (a) an employerâs final return under section 22; and
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâthe
          information given to the DGE for the group under section
          88B of the Act.
     (2) The value of Queensland fringe benefits for the last year of tax
     is the grossed-up value of the benefits.
     (3) The value of Queensland fringe benefits for the year of tax
     ending in the employerâs election year is the grossed-up value of
     the benefits.
Application of subdivision

chunks.title: Regulation 18 - Application of subdivision
chunks.main_structural_heading: Application of subdivision
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 3 - Value of fringe benefits calculated on estimated value basis in > Regulation 18
chunks.text:
This subdivision applies to an employer for whom an election under division 2,
subdivision 2 applies.
Periodic return on estimated value basis

chunks.title: Regulation 19 - Periodic return on estimated value basis
chunks.main_structural_heading: Periodic return on estimated value basis
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 3 - Value of fringe benefits calculated on estimated value basis in > Regulation 19
chunks.text:
(1) The estimated value amount for the employer to be included in a
     periodic return for a periodic return period of 1 month in a
     financial year is one-twelfth of the value of the employerâs
     Queensland fringe benefits for the previous year of tax.
     (2) The estimated value amount for the employer to be included in a
     periodic return for a periodic return period of 3 months in a
     financial year is one-quarter of the value of the employerâs
     Queensland fringe benefits for the previous year of tax.
     (3) The estimated value amount for the employer to be included in a
     periodic return for a periodic return period of 6 months in a
     financial year is one-half of the value of the employerâs
     Queensland fringe benefits for the previous year of tax.
Annual return and information given on estimated value basis

chunks.title: Regulation 20 - Annual return and information given on estimated value basis
chunks.main_structural_heading: Annual return and information given on estimated value basis
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 3 - Value of fringe benefits calculated on estimated value basis in > Regulation 20
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies forâ
          (a) the employerâs annual return for a financial year;
          and
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâthe
          information given to the DGE for the group under section
          88A (5) of the Act for the financial year.
     (2) The estimated value amount to be included in the annual return
     and information is the value of the employerâs Queensland fringe
     benefits for the last year of tax.
Application of subdivision

chunks.title: Regulation 21 - Application of subdivision
chunks.main_structural_heading: Application of subdivision
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 4 - Value of fringe benefits calculated on estimated value basis in > Regulation 21
chunks.text:
This subdivision applies to an employer if, when a change of status happens for
the employer, an election under division 2, subdivision 2 applies.
Final return and information given on estimated value basis

chunks.title: Regulation 22 - Final return and information given on estimated value basis
chunks.main_structural_heading: Final return and information given on estimated value basis
chunks.structure_path: Part 3 - FRINGE BENEFITS > Division 3 - Value of fringe benefitsâAct, s 97 > Subdivision 4 - Value of fringe benefits calculated on estimated value basis in > Regulation 22
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies forâ
          (a) the employerâs final return for a final period; and
          (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâthe
          information given to the DGE for the group under section
          88B of the Act.
     (2) The value of fringe benefits to be included in the final return
     and information as part of the wages paid or payable during the final
     period for the final return by the employer is the difference between
     the following amountsâ
          (a) the total ofâ
               (i) the value of the employerâs Queensland
               fringe benefits for the last year of tax; and
               (ii) the value of any Queensland fringe benefits
               paid or payable by the employer in April, May or
               June of the final period;
          (b) one-quarter of the value of the employerâs Queensland
          fringe benefits for the year of tax ending in the
          employerâs election year.
Definition for part

chunks.title: Regulation 23 - Definition for part
chunks.main_structural_heading: Definition for part
chunks.structure_path: Part 4 - TRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS > Division 1 - Transitional provisions for SL No. 147 of 2019 > Regulation 23
chunks.text:
In this partâ
"expired regulation" means the Payroll Tax Regulation 2009 as in force
immediately before the commencement.
Continuation of election under s 12 of expired regulation

chunks.title: Regulation 24 - Continuation of election under s 12 of expired regulation
chunks.main_structural_heading: Continuation of election under s 12 of expired regulation
chunks.structure_path: Part 4 - TRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS > Division 1 - Transitional provisions for SL No. 147 of 2019 > Regulation 24
chunks.text:
An election made by an employer under section 12(1) of the expired regulation,
that applies immediately before the commencement, is taken to be an election by
the employer under section 10(1).
Application, consent and continuation of election under s 13 of expired
regulation

chunks.title: Regulation 25 - Application, consent and continuation of election under s 13 of expired Regulation
chunks.main_structural_heading: Application, consent and continuation of election under s 13 of expired Regulation
chunks.structure_path: Part 4 - TRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS > Division 1 - Transitional provisions for SL No. 147 of 2019 > Regulation 25
chunks.text:
(1) An application for consent made by an employer under section 13
     (2) of the expired regulation, that has not been decided by the
     commissioner before the commencement, is taken to be an application
     for consent under section 11(2).
     (2) Consent given by the commissioner under section 13 of the expired
     regulation is taken to be consent given by the commissioner under
     section 11.
     (3) An election made by an employer under section 13(7) of the
     expired regulation, that applies immediately before the commencement,
     is taken to be an election by the employer under section 11(7).
Continuation of election under s 14 of expired regulation

chunks.title: Regulation 26 - Continuation of election under s 14 of expired regulation
chunks.main_structural_heading: Continuation of election under s 14 of expired regulation
chunks.structure_path: Part 4 - TRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS > Division 1 - Transitional provisions for SL No. 147 of 2019 > Regulation 26
chunks.text:
An election made by an employer under section 14(1) of the expired regulation,
that applies immediately before the commencement, is taken to be an election by
the employer under section 12(1).
Application, consent and continuation of election under s 15 of expired
regulation

chunks.title: Regulation 27 - Application, consent and continuation of election under s 15 of expired Regulation
chunks.main_structural_heading: Application, consent and continuation of election under s 15 of expired Regulation
chunks.structure_path: Part 4 - TRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS > Division 1 - Transitional provisions for SL No. 147 of 2019 > Regulation 27
chunks.text:
(1) An application for consent made by an employer under section 15
     (2) of the expired regulation, that has not been decided by the
     commissioner before the commencement, is taken to be an application
     for consent under section 13(2).
     (2) Consent given by the commissioner under section 15 of the expired
     regulation is taken to be consent given by the commissioner under
     section 13.
     (3) An election made by an employer under section 15(7) of the
     expired regulation, that applies immediately before the commencement,
     is taken to be an election by the employer under section 13(7).
Basis for calculating fringe benefits applies in relation to mental health levy

chunks.title: Regulation 28 - Basis for calculating fringe benefits applies in relation to mental health levy
chunks.main_structural_heading: Basis for calculating fringe benefits applies in relation to mental health levy
chunks.structure_path: Payroll Tax Regulation 2019 > Regulation 28
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies to an employer if a relevant election made
     by the employer applied to the employer immediately before the
     commencement.
     (2) From the commencement, and until the employer makes another
     election under part 3, division 2, the relevant election also applies
     for working outâ
          (a) the employerâs periodic levy liability; and
          (b) if the employer is not a group member or is the DGE for
          a groupâthe employerâs annual levy liability.
     (3) In this sectionâ
     "relevant election", for an employer, means an election made by the
     employer under part 3, division 2 to include in returns estimated
     value amounts or actual value amounts and use those amounts to work
     out the employerâs periodic and annual liability.

chunks.title: Schedule 1 - *** SCHEDULE 1 - Dictionary *** "actual value amount" means an amount for Queensland fringe benefits calculated on an actual value basis. "election year", for an employer, means the financial year in which the employer last made an election under part 3, division 2, subdivision 2. "estimated value amount" means an amount for Queensland fringe benefits calculated on an estimated value basis. "fringe benefits tax" means the tax imposed on fringe benefits under the Fringe Benefits Assessment Act. "grossed-up value", of a fringe benefit, for part 3, division 3, subdivision 2, see section 15. "last year of tax", for a financial year, means the year of tax ending on 31 March of the financial year. "previous year of tax", for a financial year, means the year of tax ending on Regulation 31 March before the start of the financial year. "Queensland fringe benefits" means fringe benefits, whether calculated on an actual value or estimated value basisâ (a) that are taxable wages; and (b) for which fringe benefits tax is paid or payable. "reconciliation amount", for a financial year for an employer, means the difference between the followingâ (a) the total ofâ (i) the value of the employerâs Queensland fringe benefits for the last year of tax; and (ii) the value of the employerâs Queensland fringe benefits for April, May and June of the financial year; (b) one-quarter of the value of the employerâs Queensland fringe benefits for the year of tax ending in the employerâs election year. "relevant financial year", for part 3, division 2, subdivision 2, see section 9. "relevant payroll tax and levy liabilities", for an employer, meansâ (a) if the employer is not a group member or is the DGE for a groupâthe employerâs periodic liability, annual liability, periodic levy liability and annual levy liability; or (b) if the employer is a non-DGE group memberâthe employerâs periodic liability, annual liability and periodic levy liability. "year of tax" see the Fringe Benefits Assessment Act, section 136 (1).
